alert.note: Alert for Yakima Valley (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 03 at 3:18PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...RISES ON STREAMS AND RIVERS WILL CONTINUE DUE TO SNOWMELT AND PRECIPITATIOON... Streams and rivers emanating from the mountains will continue to see rises over the weekend. The low in California is sending wrap around precipitation into the region along with already warm temperatures. Given above normal snowpack and added precipitation, will lead to rises in streams and rivers with several gauges forecasted to meet or exceed bankfull over the weekend. John Day River at at Service Creek is expected to go to moderate by Saturday and will continue to be monitored. The Naches at Naches and Cliffdell & Naches, Grande Ronde at Troy, Imnaha at Imnaha have already risen above bankfull and are expected to reach minor flood stage over the weekend. Yakima River at Umtanum & Kiona and the Grande Ronde at Perry as well as North Fork at John Day are expected to reach action stage over the weekend. Widespread flooding is currently not anticipated. This Hydrologic Outlook will be updated again each afternoon with any pertinent updates concerning the latest flood forecast.
